title: krogothmanhattan
author: krogothmanhattan
content: First of thanks to Smoothie for organizing this Charity auction for anyone who was YOGGED! and also to everyone who donated their precious collectable ¬†¬†to this event.¬†¬† I wanted to create this thread so all affected parties can place their input and then we can decide what is the appropriate and fair way to give out the ¬† proceeds.¬†¬† SO the question now is, how are or should the proceeds ¬†be distributed. ¬†¬†My thinking is as follows....¬†¬† ¬†For anyone whose cards were swept and did not get reimbursed by CYGAN, then they should be made whole.¬†¬† ¬†Once that is done, I feel CYGAN should be given back the BTC he doled out to cover guys like myself who did accept¬†¬† his BTC as they only wanted it back from Dogg.¬†¬† ¬†If there is any BTC leftover, then I say it should be given to the people who ordered cards and never received them.¬†¬† ¬†Those are just my two satoshi....Please feel free to add your thoughts and ideas and I am sure a consensus will be ¬†¬† ¬†reached eventually that everyone is happy with.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Is it possible to get an itemized list of who falls into which category and the outcome/response ?This will help when funds are distributed and accounted forThank you

comments.author: Hookzup1
comments.created_time: March 09, 2023, 02:30:41 PMLast edit: March 09, 2023, 03:08:09 PM by Hookzup1
comments.body: Thank you krogothmanhattan for posting this as I didn't see us getting far without some sort of game plan.I never accepted funds from cygan as I saw it as taking from another innocent victim but the auction made much more sense to me about getting some reimbursement for holding the directly affected halving sets that got yogged. I know the auction funds would not cover all the yogged sets but I made a list of all the ones I could find so members could post which they hold and obviously cygan being repaid for all the ones he bc1qhalvedp07ancrf8dkfwj0laj4p9utyqrj4xz35, bc1qhalvedmfxrtj9f0g6jwwshupzmqke4lapemd2yI put a sad face next to my 12 that were swept by yogg and here is a picture of them all still assembledhttps://imgur.com/a/T5mC9i8Thanks a lot to smoothie, minerjones, cygan, krogothmanhattan, and everyone else that made this come together for the victims and have done what they can to help since the issueüôèMaybe they can be crossed off or deleted as repaid ü§îI also paid for and never recieved a set of the personal basorexia cards for 625 and 2 sets of crypto bonds, one for each of my daughter's future birthdays to be unlocked .001,.0025, and .005 funding and 100$ worth of btc for each set, all funding and fees paid up front but never recieved. There are other orders I never recieved but I don't care as these are the main 2 I was excited about If someone can copy my list and cross-reference the cygan paid for wallets that would be great it's not very easy to do this using my phone and my boss has me working more than full time these days

comments.author: Cueneyt1986
comments.body: I was yogged too...What should I do?

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: woohoo yet another thread about coldkey scam¬†  there are too many - I am giving up reading them all its the same thing repeated over and over just in multiple places - like a dozen broken records.none of my cards were emptied by yoggI lost premium due to the high purchase prices I paid for cards - I lost the 25 cards paid for that were never sent and I lost the .05 I loaned yogg.But I am done with the thread after thread of repetitious postings of the same subject.

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Thanks guys for the feedback! I am sure more people will chime in.¬† I was made whole by Cygan when it came to the BTC never loaded or swept.¬† If there are any leftovers after every one is made whole, I ordered two cards that were never shipped.¬† @Cueneyt1986 I think you should post what cards were swept etc etc on this thread for all to see as proof of loss.¬† I am not the one distributing the BTC from the auction...how its done and to whom is yet to be determined, thats why I created this thread¬† to have it all organized in one place

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: JanEmil on March 09, 2023, 02:22:18 PMFinance ninja beatingsLOL. I‚Äôm sure Yogg probably appreciates seeing comments like this. I think you‚Äôre kidding, but there are a lot of crazies on the internet so don‚Äôt fire them up too much. I‚Äôm a bit disappointed that Yogg didn‚Äôt stick around if this was just a bad gambling decision. I think those who call him a friend should talk him into joining a signature campaign and donating all of his proceeds to coldkey victims he stole from until they‚Äôre all paid back no matter how long it takes.

comments.author: YodasRedRocket
comments.body: I think we should use the funds to do a custom ballet card with some cool art.¬† If Lucho doesn't want to participate & one of our talented artists like KryptoWerk didn't want to contribute, there's an idea below.¬† All extra funds are distributed to the cards.Anyone who was swiped, peeled after warning, were due items from Yogg they never received & the charity auction donators all get one.

comments.author: lebnor
comments.body: Quote from: Cueneyt1986 on March 09, 2023, 03:27:11 PMI was yogged too...What should I do?I was too and wondered the same thing until I decided to chalk it up as a lesson learned and let it go. Perceiving myself as a victim wasn‚Äôt something I was willing to do after ‚Äúdoing my own research‚Äù. That wasn‚Äôt my first rodeo and probably not my last.. Best of luck

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on March 09, 2023, 08:22:28 PMLOL. I‚Äôm sure Yogg probably appreciates seeing comments like this. I think you‚Äôre kidding, but there are a lot of crazies on the internet so don‚Äôt fire them up too much. I‚Äôm a bit disappointed that Yogg didn‚Äôt stick around if this was just a bad gambling decision. I think those who call him a friend should talk him into joining a signature campaign and donating all of his proceeds to coldkey victims he stole from until they‚Äôre all paid back no matter how long it takes. You don't get it and you clearly don't read replies. Yogg is NOT looking or logging into this forum at all. How Do I know that? Because I've posted it 10 times already and you're just a lazy shitposter for your 1 BTC a month from Stake.com... Get a real job loser...  <end shit on Ognasty shitposts> For the record I was ONLY rugged of a silver set. Did I seek refund from cygan? No. Do I want him to refund me? Hell no. Do I care if I get refunded? Not really, I've suffered much greater losses TBH. Anyhow, yogg will shortly be living in the shitty parts of paris with probably a needle in his arma few times a day. Fuck that guy.I don't believe in dwelling on anger and negativity. I've already moved on. I suggest you all try to as well, as dwelling on this POS is not worth the time or typing energy. Not mention it's just a waste of Internet as well..

That's also a good idea.¬† I like all the ideas being posted and will go along with what the majority of the victims want to do.¬† Eventually a decision has to be made especially now that the auctions are over.¬† So please anyone who was affected and wants a say on what happens, please post your opinions! Cheers!

comments.author: raritycheck
comments.body: What‚Äôs the final total BTC, please? And total how many community impacted users are there?These are some of our suggestions1. Create limited edition unload-able silver coins (we will do unique design proposals and people can chose). This design will never be reused. All work from our side will be for free as long as we are in budget. 2. Same option like 1 but loadable / buyer funded coins 3. Give the amount to chosen charity of impacted people. (Can be per person)4. As someone mentioned order custom ballet cards.5. Divide btc by total users and give to each user.6. Bulk buy of known silver crypto coins like Niue coins, etc and give to impacted users.Regards

comments.author: YodasRedRocket
comments.body: Quote from: haloxon on March 10, 2023, 10:55:59 AMI would suggest:compensation of stolen loaded amounts (ppl not yet having received compensation)compensation of loans and of 'paid but never received' orderscygan for compensating scammed ppl... coz these are objective figures.I'm undecided when it comes to premiums as those are very subjective. likewise in a legal case you would seldom receive the sentimental/collector's add-on value (premium).(speaking of an European legal understanding (yogg/coldkey as European individual/legal entity); don't know about strange US case law regime)Secret personal loans should not be reimbursed in any scenario imo.For one, if these people who all know eachother had shared this info, the reality of Yogg being a dead best dick sucker would have surfaced long ago & a lot of people wouldn‚Äôt be in the spot they are today.

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Quote from: YodasRedRocket on March 10, 2023, 12:32:33 PMQuote from: haloxon on March 10, 2023, 10:55:59 AMI would suggest:compensation of stolen loaded amounts (ppl not yet having received compensation)compensation of loans and of 'paid but never received' orderscygan for compensating scammed ppl... coz these are objective figures.I'm undecided when it comes to premiums as those are very subjective. likewise in a legal case you would seldom receive the sentimental/collector's add-on value (premium).(speaking of an European legal understanding (yogg/coldkey as European individual/legal entity); don't know about strange US case law regime)Secret personal loans should not be reimbursed in any scenario imo.For one, if these people who all know eachother had shared this info, the reality of Yogg being a dead best dick sucker would have surfaced long ago & a lot of people wouldn‚Äôt be in the spot they are today.¬† Sadly but true...if only we wouldve known of each others loans....All I have to say is I based it on my experience with him in the past...he always delayed his repayment but then came thru. SO I was very lenient when it came to repaying me back....figuring his depression had something to do with it. But hindsight is 20/20....lesson learned at my end and never again. ¬† And I agree....personal loans should not be covered as it was personal and not business.
